intro: Lasiosiphon kerstingii, commonly known as the Kersting's lasiosiphon, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with prominent staminodes. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, adapting to the arid and saline conditions of its native habitat. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
